intro: Hieracium crispiforme, commonly known as the curlyhead hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems, which contribute to its distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite inflorescence, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a rough texture. Hieracium crispiforme is native to Europe and is often found in meadows and grassy areas.
